title: Installing APackOfTheClones
text: APackOfTheClones extends BioConductor scRepertoire v2 package, extension Seurat package. See respective installation guides details, although users APackOfTheClones expected familiar Seurat used scRepertoire integrate clonotype data seurat object. Briefly, following work devices:
code: # install BiocManager for scRepertoire installation if (!require("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)) install.packages("BiocManager") library(BiocManager)  # install scRepertoire from Bioconductor BiocManager::install("scRepertoire")  # install Seurat from CRAN install.packages("Seurat")

title: APackOfTheClones Essentials
text: premise package provides additional analysis tool top scRepertoire’s many functions, ran combining TCR/BCR contigs clones, integrating clonal information seurat object dimensional reduction(s). corresponding vignettes read order combining contigs: Loading Data Combining Contigs Clones Additional Processing Steps (optional) practical example generate combined seurat + VDJ object used vignette named pbmc, also identical built-example dataset combined_pbmc can loaded data("combined_pbmc", package = "APackOfTheClones"): integrating clonal information, scRepertoire::combineExpression function used , APackOfTheClones scRNA-seq object seurat object: reference, corresponding UMAP plot seurat object
code: library(scRepertoire)  # load in the corresponding 6-sample TCR contigs from scRepertoire contig_list <- get(data("contig_list", package = "scRepertoire"))  # combine the TCR contigs into clones with custom samples combined_contig_list <- scRepertoire::combineTCR(   contig_list,   samples = c("P17B", "P17L", "P18B", "P18L", "P19B", "P19L", "P20B", "P20L"),   removeNA = FALSE,    removeMulti = FALSE,    filterMulti = FALSE ) # a seurat object corresponding to combined_contig_list named `pbmc` is loaded pbmc <- scRepertoire::combineExpression(   combined_contig_list,   pbmc,   cloneCall = "gene",   proportion = TRUE ) library(Seurat) library(ggplot2)  pbmc_umap_plot <- UMAPPlot(pbmc) pbmc_umap_plot + coord_fixed()

what: Working with different reduction bases and clonal representations

text: arguments : reduction_base indicates seurat cluster’s centroid locations based upon, UMAP, T-SNE, PCA (provided reduction ran object). clonecall corresponds column seurat metadata used conduct clonotype counting. usually columns generated combineTCR/BCR can custom columns . Note scRepertoire generate following columns default, brackets indicate equivalent names one can pass clonecall parameter: CTgene (gene, genes) CTnt (nt, nucleotide, nucleotides) CTaa (aa, amino) CTstrict (strict, gene+nt) Switching parameter useful user generated custom definition clones added meta data, BCR clonal data present, since definition clone B-cells isn’t clear TCRs. Lastly, default, clonotypes grouped clusters based current active identity cells (Idents(pbmc)) case alt_ident = NULL. However, work alternative ident added seurat metadata either manually via Seurat::StashIdent, simply set alt_ident character representing name column.

Here, it is subsetted # by the keyword argument approach subset_sample_17_plot <- vizAPOTC(   pbmc,   orig.ident = c("P17B", "P17L"),   retain_axis_scales = TRUE,   add_size_legend = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE )  # here, it is subsetted with `extra_filter` for sample 18 with dplyr syntax: subset_sample_18_plot <- vizAPOTC(   pbmc,   extra_filter = "substr(orig.ident, 1, 3) == 'P18'",   retain_axis_scales = TRUE,   add_size_legend = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE )  # here, sample 19 is subsetted with both arguments to show that they work in conjunction subset_sample_19_plot <- vizAPOTC(   pbmc,   orig.ident = "P19B",   extra_filter = "orig.ident == 'P19L' | orig.ident == 'P19B'",   retain_axis_scales = TRUE,   add_size_legend = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE )  cowplot::plot_grid(   vizAPOTC(combined_pbmc, add_size_legend = FALSE, verbose = FALSE),   subset_sample_17_plot,   subset_sample_18_plot,   subset_sample_19_plot,   labels = c("all", "17", "18", "19") )

title: APackOfTheClones Essentials
text: seurat cluster index \(\), final radii \(r_{ij}\) physical circle index \(j\) representing clone size \(s_{ij}\) calculated clone size scaling factor \(C \(0, \infty)\) radius scaling factor \(R \(0, 1]\) following formula: \[ r_{ij} = C \cdot (\sqrt{s_{ij}} - (1 - R)) \] Intuitively, \(C\) represents much enlarge/shrink radius geometrically relative clone size, whereas \(R\) represents scaled size smallest clone’s radius, circles radii decreased amount. \(R\) defaults 0.95, whereas \(C\) defaults approximated factor based number clones package computes. corresponding arguments clone_scale_factor rad_scale_factor vizAPOTC.

title: APackOfTheClones Essentials
text: Considerable visual overlap clusters (due algorithm’s attempt fit clusters original UMAP coordinates) may occur obstruct eachother excessively. APackOfTheClones default tries alleviate repulsing overlapping clusters away eachother. four optional arguments: repulsion_threshold indicates amount ggplot2 units overlap clusters acceptable. defaults 1, meaning two clusters overlap 1 unit considered repulsion algorithm overlapping. Increasing number increase amount overlap clusters, decreasing number opposite, decreasing negative values incur additional spacing clusters. Note current version, two clusters considered overlapping comparing approximated radii, computed right-x coordinate. isn’t accurate approximation smaller clusters non-circular borders. repulsion_strength relates much clusters repel . repulsion algorithm works iterations, iteration, cluster “pushes” away eachother amount. Increasing value cause extra “pushing” iteration. However, increasing factor much may result visually unpleasant plot. max_repulsion_iter indicates number iterations clusters repel eachother. Increasing number ensure clusters (almost always) sure overlapping. trick parameter make pleasant plots decrease repulsion_strength increase max_repulsion_iter possibly make pleasant arrangement clusters. details , read “Arguments” section function documentation. Briefly, first, make circle clusters move away eachother, repulse set TRUE, function ran . (feel excessive re-running takes long inefficient workflow current form due constant need fine-tune, see vignette APackOfTheClones-runs.)
code: repulse = TRUE, repulsion_threshold = 1, repulsion_strength = 1, max_repulsion_iter = 10

code: library(Seurat) suppressPackageStartupMessages(library(APackOfTheClones))  # Here, a Seurat object has already been loaded named `pbmc` print(pbmc) #> An object of class Seurat  #> 31053 features across 8000 samples within 1 assay  #> Active assay: RNA (31053 features, 2000 variable features) #>  3 layers present: counts, data, scale.data #>  2 dimensional reductions calculated: pca, umap umap_plot <- UMAPPlot(pbmc) umap_plot head(tcr_dataframe) library(readr) tcr_dataframe <- readr::read_csv("your_file_location/all_contig_annotations.csv")

Setting repulse TRUE default parameters probably yield something like following:  can see, red green clusters “moved away” , little overlap remaining. clusters touching remain original positions. still unhappy spacing plot, see following ways adjust spacing: repulsion_threshold indicates amount ggplot2 units overlap clusters acceptable. defaults 1, meaning two clusters overlap 1 unit considered repulsion algorithm overlapping. Increasing number increase amount overlap clusters, decreasing number opposite, decreasing negative values incur additional spacing clusters. However, using negative spacing may cause plot look spaced . Keep reading see alternatives . repulsion_strength relates much clusters repel . repulsion algorithm works iterations, iteration, cluster “pushes” away eachother amount. Increasing value cause extra “pushing” iteration. However, increasing factor much may result visually unpleasant plot. Note closer clusters repell eachother , larger clusters repel smaller clusters . max_repulsion_iter indicates number iterations clusters repel eachother. Increasing number ensure clusters (almost always) sure overlapping. trick parameter make pleasant plots decrease repulsion_strength increase max_repulsion_iter possibly make pleasant arrangement clusters.

what: Visualization of Clonal Expansion for Single Cell Immune Profiles
title: Visualization of Clonal Expansion for Single Cell Immune Profiles
text: APackOfTheClones R package extends bioconductor scRepertoire package produce easily customizable “ball-packing” visualizations clonal expansion T-cells/B-cells Seurat object, based receptor library single cell RNA sequencing data (example outputs 10X genomics’ single-cell immune profiling). baseline concept first implemented study Ma et al.[1] Murray Christian Ben Murrell (@Murrellb) nasal polyp TH cells. APackOfTheClones counts clonotype frequencies seurat/umap cluster produces circle packing frequencies intuitively represent clonal expansion. packing cluster plotted roughly coordinates original dimensional reduction color. example APackOfTheClones used example seurat object scRepertoire corresponding VDJ library:

title: Visualization of Clonal Expansion for Single Cell Immune Profiles
text: APackOfTheClones registered CRAN. install latest stable release, simply run following details installation methods information alternative/development versions, see vignette("APackOfTheClones-install")
code: install.packages("APackOfTheClones")

title: Visualization of Clonal Expansion for Single Cell Immune Profiles
text: package extends functionality scRepertoire v2 working seurat object’s corresponding T/B cell receptor library. , read scRepertoire vignette. Briefly, scTCR-seq/scBCR-seq experiment (e.g. 10X genomics single cell immune profiling run) processed scRepertoire::combineTCR / scRepertoire::combineBCR first. , integrated corresponding seurat object either scRepertoire::combineExpression. quickly produce visualization, vizAPOTC(your_combined_seurat_object) give reasonable visualization. example seurat object included package can used data("combined_pbmc"). following codechunk example can done: finer control visualization / parameters, data run can stored adjusted RunAPOTC AdjustAPOTC, visualized APOTCPlot, like :
code: library(Seurat) library(scRepertoire) # ensure v2 is installed: devtools::install_github("ncborcherding/scRepertoire") library(APackOfTheClones)  # integrate the contigs with scRepertoire example data - this is identical to "combined_pbmc" pbmc <- get(data("mini_contig_list", package = "scRepertoire")) %>%     combineTCR(         samples = c("P17B", "P17L", "P18B", "P18L", "P19B", "P19L", "P20B", "P20L")     ) %>%     combineExpression(get(data("scRep_example", package = "scRepertoire")))  # produce the ball-packing plot with the default parameters vizAPOTC(pbmc)  # there are many parameters to adjust, but most importantly, one can filter for # subsets of the seurat object easily with keyword arguments corresponding to # columns in the meta.data dataframe in the seurat object. Here, we filter for # only the clones of the sample "P17" in a column named "orig.ident" that are only # in seurat clusters 1, 3, and 4. vizAPOTC(pbmc, orig.ident = c("P17B", "P17L"), seurat_clusters = c(1, 3, 4)) # using the same seurat object as before, run and store associated data, # identifying it with a run id. If not, one will be generated. pbmc <- RunAPOTC(pbmc, run_id = "default_run_1")  # plot the corresponding data with the run_id. If not provided, will use the latest run. APOTCPlot(pbmc)  # adjust the sizes of the clones and move the 2nd cluster to (0, 0). Run id this time was # left empty for no particular reason, but it will use "default_run_1" since its the latest pbmc <- AdjustAPOTC(     pbmc,     new_clone_scale_factor = 0.25,     relocate_cluster = 2,     relocation_coord = c(0, 0) )  # one can also do another run with different parameters and a different id. pbmc <- RunAPOTC(pbmc, run_id = "run2", try_place = TRUE, repulse = FALSE)  # plot both runs side by side library(cowplot) cowplot::plot_grid(     APOTCPlot(pbmc, run_id = "default_run_1"), APOTCPlot(pbmc, run_id = "run2") )

title: Various variations of visualizations of clonal expansion post-RunAPOTC — APOTCPlot
text: seurat_obj seurat object integrated clonotype data valid run RunAPOTC. reduction_base character. seurat reduction base clonal expansion plotting . Defaults 'umap' can reduction present within reductions slot input seurat object, including custom ones. `'pca'``, cluster coordinates based PC1 PC2. However, generally APackOfTheClones used displaying UMAP occasionally t-SNE versions intuitively highlight clonal expansion. clonecall character. column name seurat object metadata use. See scRepertoire documentation information parameter central packages. ... additional "subsetting" keyword arguments indicating rows corresponding elements seurat object metadata filtered . E.g., seurat_clusters = c(1, 9, 10) filter cells seurat_clusters column values 1, 9, 10. Unfortunately, column names seurat object metadata conflict keyword arguments. MAJOR NOTE subsetting keyword arguments prefix preceding argument names (e.g. column named reduction prefix reduction_base argument) R interpret argument unless arguments named. Additionally, means subsequent arguments must named. extra_filter character. additional string formatted exactly like statement one pass dplyr::filter additional filtering cells seurat object - top keyword arguments - based metadata. means logically 'ed keyword argument filters. flexible alternative / addition filtering keyword arguments. example, one wanted filter length amino acid sequence TCRs, one pass something like extra_filter = "nchar(CTaa) - 1 > 10". involving characters, ensure enclose single quotes. run_id character. ID associated data run, used important functions like APOTCPlot AdjustAPOTC. Defaults NULL, case ID generated following format: reduction_base;clonecall;keyword_arguments;extra_filter keyword arguments extra_filter underscore characters input ... extra_filter parameters. show_shared output getSharedClones can inputted , resulting plot overlay lines clone circles clonotype common clusters. Note input must generated data correct APackOfTheClones run, behavior undefined otherwise likely error. next 4 arguments allow aesthetic customization line links. only_link Optional integer indicating display clone links originating cluster showing shared clones. clone_link_width numeric. width lines connect shared clones. Defaults "auto" estimate reasonable value depending circle sizes. clone_link_color character. color lines connect shared clones. Defaults "blend" use average colors two connected clones. Else, hex color valid color string input work, corresponding color applied links. clone_link_alpha numeric. alpha lines connect shared clones. res number points generated path per full circle. plot viewers, circles seem slightly pixelated, recommended first try export plot .svg increasing res due increased plotting times ggforce::geom_circle. linetype type outline circle . defaults "blank meaning outline. information function documentation ggforce::geom_circle. use_default_theme logical defaults TRUE. TRUE, resulting plot theme seurat reference reduction plot. Else, plot simply blank background. retain_axis_scales TRUE, approximately maintains axis scales original reduction plot. However, attempt extend axes never shorten. Users recommended set TRUE especially working subsetted versions clonal data better preserve geometric relation original dimensional reduction. alpha numeric. alpha circles (0, 1]. Defaults 1. show_labels TRUE, label circle cluster centroid, defaulting "C0, C1, ...". label_size text size labels shown. Defaults 5. add_size_legend TRUE, adds legend plot visualizing relative sizes clones. Note simply overlay real ggplot2 legend. legend_sizes numeric vector. Indicates circle sizes displayed legend, always sorted smallest greatest. Defaults "auto" estimate reasonable range sizes display. legend_position character numeric. Can set either "top_left", "top_right", "bottom_left", "bottom_right" places legend roughly corresponding position. Otherwise, can numeric vector length 2 indicating x y position topmost (smallest) circle legend. legend_buffer numeric. Indicates much "push" legend towards center plot selected corner. negative, push away legend_color character. Indicates hex color circles displayed legend. Defaults hex code gray tone legend_spacing numeric. Indicates horizontal distance stacked circle size legend. Defaults "auto" use estimated value depending plot size legend_label character. title legend, defaults "clone sizes. legend_text_size numeric. text size letters numbers legend add_legend_background logical. TRUE, add border around legend fill background white, overlaying anything else. add_legend_centerspace numeric. additional amount distance changed circle sizes left side legend numbers right. Useful set around 0.5 (/ less) particularly large clone sizes may cover numbers. detail logical. FALSE, plot entire clusters one large circle, may useful cases high number clones resulting large number circles resulting ggplot, increased plotting times, certain aspects plot needs finely adjusted AdjustAPOTC simply inspected. set FALSE actual clonal expansion plot. verbose logical. Decides visual cues displayed R console progress.

title: Adjust the parameters of the APackOfTheClones reduction in a seurat object — AdjustAPOTC
code: # do an APackOfTheClones run pbmc <- RunAPOTC(get(data("combined_pbmc")), verbose = FALSE)  # adjust the rad_scale_factor, and nudge cluster 1 by x = 1, y = 1 pbmc <- AdjustAPOTC(     pbmc,     new_rad_scale_factor = 0.9,     nudge_cluster = 1,     nudge_vector = c(1, 1),     verbose = FALSE ) #> * using the latest APackOfTheClones Run Data with object id: umap;CTstrict;_;_  # plot the result APOTCPlot(pbmc) #> * using the latest APackOfTheClones Run Data with object id: umap;CTstrict;_;_ #> * generated ggplot object   # rename some labels pbmc <- AdjustAPOTC(     pbmc, rename_label = c(2, 5), new_label = c("Foo", "Bar") ) #> * using the latest APackOfTheClones Run Data with object id: umap;CTstrict;_;_  # perhaps multiple clusters need to be relocated and repulsed pbmc <- AdjustAPOTC(     pbmc,     relocate_cluster = c("Foo", "C10"), # using labels works too     relocation_coord = list(c(2, 3.5), c(0, 5)),     repulse = TRUE,     verbose = FALSE ) #> * using the latest APackOfTheClones Run Data with object id: umap;CTstrict;_;_  # plot again to check results APOTCPlot(pbmc, show_labels = TRUE, verbose = FALSE) #> * using the latest APackOfTheClones Run Data with object id: umap;CTstrict;_;_

title: Run the APackOfTheClones method on a combined Seurat object for downstream visualization of clonal expansion — RunAPOTC
code: data("combined_pbmc")  # this is the recommended approach to use a custom run_id with default params combined_pbmc <- RunAPOTC(combined_pbmc, run_id = "default", verbose = FALSE)  # here's a seperate run with some filters to the meta data, where # `orig.ident` is a custom column in the example data. Notice that it is not # a `RunAPOTC` parameter but a user keyword argument combined_pbmc <- RunAPOTC(     combined_pbmc, run_id = "sample17", orig.ident = c("P17B", "P17L"),     verbose = FALSE )  # the exact same thing can be achieved with the `extra_filter` parameter combined_pbmc <- RunAPOTC(     combined_pbmc,     run_id = "sample17",     extra_filter = "substr(orig.ident, 2, 3) == '17'",     override = TRUE,     verbose = FALSE )

what: DEFUNCT: count the number of clonotype sizes per cell cluster in a seurat object integrated with a TCR library — count_clone_sizes
title: DEFUNCT: count the number of clonotype sizes per cell cluster in a seurat object integrated with a TCR library — count_clone_sizes
text: v0.1.x functions deprecated, workflow completely revamped - now depending scRepertoire v2 package - allows processing multi-sampled single cell data. Please read vignettes browseVignettes("APackOfTheClones")visit https://qile0317.github.io/APackOfTheClones/

what: Delete the results of an APackOfTheClones run — deleteApotcData
title: Delete the results of an APackOfTheClones run — deleteApotcData
text: convenience function erase data associated particular run, including ApotcData command seurat_obj@command. run_id longer accessible afterwards.

code: deleteApotcData(seurat_obj, run_id)

title: Delete the results of an APackOfTheClones run — deleteApotcData
text: seurat_obj seurat object RunAPOTC ran order functions called. run_id character. id associated ApotcRun.

title: Delete the results of an APackOfTheClones run — deleteApotcData
text: modified input seurat object

title: Delete the results of an APackOfTheClones run — deleteApotcData
code: pbmc <- RunAPOTC(     seurat_obj = get(data("combined_pbmc")),     reduction_base = "umap",     clonecall = "strict",     run_id = "run1",     verbose = FALSE )  getApotcDataIds(pbmc) #> [1] "run1" #> [1] "run1"  # delete the data pbmc <- deleteApotcData(pbmc, "run1")  getApotcDataIds(pbmc) #> NULL #> NULL

title: Get all run ids of previous RunAPOTC runs on a seurat object — getApotcDataIds
code: pbmc <- RunAPOTC(     seurat_obj = get(data("combined_pbmc")),     reduction_base = "umap",     clonecall = "strict",     verbose = FALSE )  getApotcDataIds(pbmc) #> [1] "umap;CTstrict;_;_" #> [1] "umap;CTstrict;_;_"  pbmc <- RunAPOTC(     seurat_obj = pbmc,     reduction_base = "umap",     clonecall = "gene",     verbose = FALSE )  getApotcDataIds(pbmc) #> [1] "umap;CTstrict;_;_" "umap;CTgene;_;_"   #> [1] "umap;CTstrict;_;_" "umap;CTgene;_;_"

code: # first run pbmc <- RunAPOTC(     seurat_obj = get(data("combined_pbmc")),     reduction_base = "umap",     clonecall = "strict",     verbose = FALSE )  getLastApotcDataId(pbmc) #> [1] "umap;CTstrict;_;_" #> [1] "umap;CTstrict;_;_"  # second run with a different clonecall pbmc <- RunAPOTC(     seurat_obj = pbmc,     reduction_base = "umap",     clonecall = "gene",     verbose = FALSE )  getLastApotcDataId(pbmc) #> [1] "umap;CTgene;_;_" #> [1] "umap;CTgene;_;_"

what: Compute a list of clonotypes that are shared between seurat clusters — getSharedClones
title: Compute a list of clonotypes that are shared between seurat clusters — getSharedClones
text: function convenience function users get list clonotypes shared seurat clusters. run_id inputted, function attempt get shared clonotypes corresponding APackOfTheClones run generated RunAPOTC. Otherwise, use filtering / subsetting parameters generate shared clones internally running RunAPOTC parameters returning shared clones.

title: Compute a list of clonotypes that are shared between seurat clusters — getSharedClones
code: getSharedClones(   seurat_obj,   reduction_base = "umap",   clonecall = "strict",   ...,   extra_filter = NULL,   alt_ident = NULL,   run_id = NULL,   top = NULL,   top_per_cl = NULL,   intop = NULL,   intop_per_cl = NULL,   publicity = c(2L, Inf) )

title: Compute a list of clonotypes that are shared between seurat clusters — getSharedClones
text: seurat_obj Seurat object one dimension reductions already integrated TCR/BCR library scRepertoire::combineExpression. reduction_base character. seurat reduction base clonal expansion plotting . Defaults 'umap' can reduction present within reductions slot input seurat object, including custom ones. `'pca'``, cluster coordinates based PC1 PC2. However, generally APackOfTheClones used displaying UMAP occasionally t-SNE versions intuitively highlight clonal expansion. clonecall character. column name seurat object metadata use. See scRepertoire documentation information parameter central packages. ... additional "subsetting" keyword arguments indicating rows corresponding elements seurat object metadata filtered . E.g., seurat_clusters = c(1, 9, 10) filter cells seurat_clusters column values 1, 9, 10. Unfortunately, column names seurat object metadata conflict keyword arguments. MAJOR NOTE subsetting keyword arguments prefix preceding argument names (e.g. column named reduction prefix reduction_base argument) R interpret argument unless arguments named. Additionally, means subsequent arguments must named. extra_filter character. additional string formatted exactly like statement one pass dplyr::filter additional filtering cells seurat object - top keyword arguments - based metadata. means logically 'ed keyword argument filters. flexible alternative / addition filtering keyword arguments. example, one wanted filter length amino acid sequence TCRs, one pass something like extra_filter = "nchar(CTaa) - 1 > 10". involving characters, ensure enclose single quotes. alt_ident character. default, cluster identity assumed whatever Idents(seurat_obj), clones grouped active ident. However, alt_ident set name column meta data seurat object grouped . column meant product Seurat::StashIdent manually added. run_id character. ID associated data run, used important functions like APOTCPlot AdjustAPOTC. Defaults NULL, case ID generated following format: reduction_base;clonecall;keyword_arguments;extra_filter keyword arguments extra_filter underscore characters input ... extra_filter parameters. top integer numeric (0, 1) - null, filters output clones shared clonotypes counts top top count / proportion (numeric (0, 1) input) shared clones kept. cases several clonotypes tie size, clonotype(s) added guaranteed deterministic given arguments identical. top_per_cl integer numeric (0, 1) - null, filters output clones seurat cluster, clonotypes top_per_cl frequency/count preserved aggregating shared clones, way . Note inputted conjunction top, get intersection clonotypes filtered way. cases several clonotypes tie size, clonotype(s) added guaranteed deterministic given arguments identical. intop integer numeric (0, 1) - null, filters raw clone sizes computing shared clonotypes clonotypes overall size top intop largest sizes (integer, else intop proportion) kept. emphasize, argument necessarily return top shared clones likely little less, filters raw clone sizes, , likely clones end shared. intop_per_cl integer numeric (0, 1) - null, filters raw clustered clone sizes computing shared clones, every clone seurat cluster, top intop_per_cl count / proportion (numeric (0, 1) input) clones kept. publicity numeric pair. simple filter range c(lowerbound, upperbound) retain shared clones "publicity" - number clusters present - within range.

what: overlay a clone size legend on an APackOfTheClones plot — overlayLegend
title: overlay a clone size legend on an APackOfTheClones plot — overlayLegend
text: function parameters related legend APOTCPlot, can plot new / override current legend. However, important input plot function plot generated solely APOTCPlot vizAPOTC due custom ggplot object. override erase additional layers user/functions added. just remove legend, see removeLegend.

title: overlay a clone size legend on an APackOfTheClones plot — overlayLegend
code: overlayLegend(   apotc_ggplot,   legend_sizes = "auto",   legend_position = "auto",   legend_buffer = 0.2,   legend_color = "#808080",   legend_spacing = "auto",   legend_label = "Clone sizes",   legend_text_size = 5,   add_legend_background = TRUE,   add_legend_centerspace = 0,   linetype = "blank",   res = 360L )

title: overlay a clone size legend on an APackOfTheClones plot — overlayLegend
text: apotc_ggplot ggplot object output APOTCPlot vizAPOTC legend_sizes numeric vector. Indicates circle sizes displayed legend, always sorted smallest greatest. Defaults "auto" estimate reasonable range sizes display. legend_position character numeric. Can set either "top_left", "top_right", "bottom_left", "bottom_right" places legend roughly corresponding position. Otherwise, can numeric vector length 2 indicating x y position topmost (smallest) circle legend. legend_buffer numeric. Indicates much "push" legend towards center plot selected corner. negative, push away legend_color character. Indicates hex color circles displayed legend. Defaults hex code gray tone legend_spacing numeric. Indicates horizontal distance stacked circle size legend. Defaults "auto" use estimated value depending plot size legend_label character. title legend, defaults "clone sizes. legend_text_size numeric. text size letters numbers legend add_legend_background logical. TRUE, add border around legend fill background white, overlaying anything else. add_legend_centerspace numeric. additional amount distance changed circle sizes left side legend numbers right. Useful set around 0.5 (/ less) particularly large clone sizes may cover numbers. linetype type outline circle . defaults "blank meaning outline. information function documentation ggforce::geom_circle. res number points generated path per full circle. plot viewers, circles seem slightly pixelated, recommended first try export plot .svg increasing res due increased plotting times ggforce::geom_circle.

what: Highlight specific clones on an APackOfTheClones ggplot — showCloneHighlight
title: Highlight specific clones on an APackOfTheClones ggplot — showCloneHighlight

title: Highlight specific clones on an APackOfTheClones ggplot — showCloneHighlight
code: showCloneHighlight(   apotc_ggplot,   clonotype,   color_each = TRUE,   default_color = "#808080",   scale_bg = 1,   fill_legend = TRUE )

title: Highlight specific clones on an APackOfTheClones ggplot — showCloneHighlight
text: apotc_ggplot ggplot object output APOTCPlot vizAPOTC APackOfTheClones plot highlighted . clonotype character vector sequence(s) highlight. Note must clonecall code created plot. warning shown sequences present. color_each Either logical length 1, character(s). TRUE default, assigns unique default ggplot color highlighted clone. FALSE, highlighted clone retain current color legend based color shown. possible application simply gauge distribution shared clone. can also indicate uniform color highlighted clone: character length 1, highlighted clones color. Else must character vector length clonotype, color corresponding clone. suitable place use palette function many CRAN palette packages "viridis" "RColorBrewer". Note currently, user must ensure clonotype contains unique characters. default_color character length 1 NULL indicating color non-highlighted clones. NULL, un-highlighted sequences retain original color sc.data. Else, character, valid color un-highlighted clones . Defaults hexcode gray. scale_bg positive numeric. Scales brightness value color non-highlighted clones scaling factor. Defaults 1 alter current brightness. Note color_each = FALSE default_color = NULL, equivalent highlighting clones - case, may useful alter scale_bg slightly non-highlighted clones darkened/brightened. fill_legend logical indicating whether ggplot legend "fill" clonotype displayed.

title: Highlight specific clones on an APackOfTheClones ggplot — showCloneHighlight
text: ggplot object data modified highlighted colors

title: Highlight specific clones on an APackOfTheClones ggplot — showCloneHighlight
text: hood, function simply mutates plotting dataframe $data ggplot object, operates column named color. Note color_each = FALSE default_color = NULL, equivalent simply highlighting anything warning shown.

title: Highlight specific clones on an APackOfTheClones ggplot — showCloneHighlight
code: data("combined_pbmc")  # piping the plot can be nice to read syntatically - # By default, assigns unique colors to highlights and everything else is gray vizAPOTC(combined_pbmc, clonecall = "aa", verbose = FALSE) |>     showCloneHighlight("CASLSGSARQLTF_CASSSTVAGEQYF")   # one useful application is to highlight shared clones - beware that the # clonotype sequences may get extremely long in the legend shared_aa_clones <- names(getSharedClones(combined_pbmc, clonecall = "aa")) vizAPOTC(combined_pbmc, clonecall = "aa", verbose = FALSE) |>     showCloneHighlight(shared_aa_clones)

what: Directly visualize clonal expansion of a combined seurat object — vizAPOTC
title: Directly visualize clonal expansion of a combined seurat object — vizAPOTC
text: function combines functionality RunAPOTC APOTCPlot. Given Seurat object, first runs APackOfTheClones method (RunAPOTC) compute clonal expansion information, generates customizable ggplot2 object clonal expansion plot circle size legend (APOTCPlot).

title: Directly visualize clonal expansion of a combined seurat object — vizAPOTC
code: vizAPOTC(   seurat_obj,   reduction_base = "umap",   clonecall = "strict",   ...,   extra_filter = NULL,   alt_ident = NULL,   clone_scale_factor = "auto",   rad_scale_factor = 0.95,   order_clones = TRUE,   try_place = FALSE,   repulse = TRUE,   repulsion_threshold = 1,   repulsion_strength = 1,   max_repulsion_iter = 20L,   show_shared = NULL,   only_link = NULL,   clone_link_width = "auto",   clone_link_color = "black",   clone_link_alpha = 0.5,   res = 360L,   linetype = "blank",   use_default_theme = TRUE,   retain_axis_scales = FALSE,   alpha = 1,   show_labels = FALSE,   label_size = 5,   add_size_legend = TRUE,   legend_sizes = "auto",   legend_position = "auto",   legend_buffer = 0.2,   legend_color = "#808080",   legend_spacing = "auto",   legend_label = "Clone sizes",   legend_text_size = 5,   add_legend_background = TRUE,   add_legend_centerspace = 0,   detail = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Directly visualize clonal expansion of a combined seurat object — vizAPOTC
text: seurat_obj seurat object integrated clonotype data scRepertoire::combineExpression. reduction_base character. seurat reduction base clonal expansion plotting . Defaults 'umap' can reduction present within reductions slot input seurat object, including custom ones. `'pca'``, cluster coordinates based PC1 PC2. However, generally APackOfTheClones used displaying UMAP occasionally t-SNE versions intuitively highlight clonal expansion. clonecall character. column name seurat object metadata use. See scRepertoire documentation information parameter central packages. ... additional "subsetting" keyword arguments indicating rows corresponding elements seurat object metadata filtered . E.g., seurat_clusters = c(1, 9, 10) filter cells seurat_clusters column values 1, 9, 10. Unfortunately, column names seurat object metadata conflict keyword arguments. MAJOR NOTE subsetting keyword arguments prefix preceding argument names (e.g. column named reduction prefix reduction_base argument) R interpret argument unless arguments named. Additionally, means subsequent arguments must named. extra_filter character. additional string formatted exactly like statement one pass dplyr::filter additional filtering cells seurat object - top keyword arguments - based metadata. means logically 'ed keyword argument filters. flexible alternative / addition filtering keyword arguments. example, one wanted filter length amino acid sequence TCRs, one pass something like extra_filter = "nchar(CTaa) - 1 > 10". involving characters, ensure enclose single quotes. alt_ident character. default, cluster identity assumed whatever Idents(seurat_obj), clones grouped active ident. However, alt_ident set name column meta data seurat object grouped . column meant product Seurat::StashIdent manually added. clone_scale_factor Dictates much scale circle(0,1) radius converting clonotype counts circles represent individual clonotypes. argument defaults character "auto", , visually pleasing factor estimated. rad_scale_factor numeric 0 1. value decreases radius smallest clones scale factor. absolute value decrease applied packed circles, effectively shrinking circles spot, introduce constant spacing . order_clones logical. Decides largest clone circles near cluster centroids. highly recommended set TRUE increased intuitiveness visualization, resulting plots tend give improved impression proportion expanded clones. FALSE, randomly scramble positions circle. sake replicable, random seed recommended set set.seed. try_place TRUE, always minimizes distance newly placed circle origin circle packing algorithm. repulse TRUE, attempt push overlapping clusters away . repulsion_threshold numeric. radius clonal circle clusters overlap acceptable repulsing. repulsion_strength numeric. smaller value less clusters repulse per iteration, vice versa. max_repulsion_iter integer. number repulsion iterations. show_shared output getSharedClones can inputted , resulting plot overlay lines clone circles clonotype common clusters. Note input must generated data correct APackOfTheClones run, behavior undefined otherwise likely error. next 4 arguments allow aesthetic customization line links. only_link Optional integer indicating display clone links originating cluster showing shared clones. clone_link_width numeric. width lines connect shared clones. Defaults "auto" estimate reasonable value depending circle sizes. clone_link_color character. color lines connect shared clones. Defaults "blend" use average colors two connected clones. Else, hex color valid color string input work, corresponding color applied links. clone_link_alpha numeric. alpha lines connect shared clones. res number points generated path per full circle. plot viewers, circles seem slightly pixelated, recommended first try export plot .svg increasing res due increased plotting times ggforce::geom_circle. linetype type outline circle . defaults "blank meaning outline. information function documentation ggforce::geom_circle. use_default_theme logical defaults TRUE. TRUE, resulting plot theme seurat reference reduction plot. Else, plot simply blank background. retain_axis_scales TRUE, approximately maintains axis scales original reduction plot. However, attempt extend axes never shorten. Users recommended set TRUE especially working subsetted versions clonal data better preserve geometric relation original dimensional reduction. alpha numeric. alpha circles (0, 1]. Defaults 1. show_labels TRUE, label circle cluster centroid, defaulting "C0, C1, ...". label_size text size labels shown. Defaults 5. add_size_legend TRUE, adds legend plot visualizing relative sizes clones. Note simply overlay real ggplot2 legend. legend_sizes numeric vector. Indicates circle sizes displayed legend, always sorted smallest greatest. Defaults "auto" estimate reasonable range sizes display. legend_position character numeric. Can set either "top_left", "top_right", "bottom_left", "bottom_right" places legend roughly corresponding position. Otherwise, can numeric vector length 2 indicating x y position topmost (smallest) circle legend. legend_buffer numeric. Indicates much "push" legend towards center plot selected corner. negative, push away legend_color character. Indicates hex color circles displayed legend. Defaults hex code gray tone legend_spacing numeric. Indicates horizontal distance stacked circle size legend. Defaults "auto" use estimated value depending plot size legend_label character. title legend, defaults "clone sizes. legend_text_size numeric. text size letters numbers legend add_legend_background logical. TRUE, add border around legend fill background white, overlaying anything else. add_legend_centerspace numeric. additional amount distance changed circle sizes left side legend numbers right. Useful set around 0.5 (/ less) particularly large clone sizes may cover numbers. detail logical. FALSE, plot entire clusters one large circle, may useful cases high number clones resulting large number circles resulting ggplot, increased plotting times, certain aspects plot needs finely adjusted AdjustAPOTC simply inspected. set FALSE actual clonal expansion plot. verbose logical. Decides visual cues displayed R console progress.

title: APackOfTheClones 1.1.0.9000 (development version)
text: vizAPOTC RunAPOTC getSharedClones countCloneSizes (see section changes incorporate identity functionality) updated vignettes reflect new argument. Add renameApotcRun rename APackOfTheClones runs. Add argument detail APOTCPlot vizAPOTC allow user quickly plot version clonal expansion plot cluster just one large circle. Correspondingly added subsection vignette("APackOfTheClones-shared"). Add argument publicity getSharedClones filter output shared clones number clusters clonotype present .

title: APackOfTheClones 1.1.0.9000 (development version)
text: vizAPOTC RunAPOTC now defaults aggregating clustered clonotype frequencies based active ident seurat object. Additionally, using ident levels ordered integers, cluster labels APackOfTheClones run stored seurat object longer just “C1”, “C2”, … names idents. Fixed output arguments intop intop_per_cl getSharedClones actually filters clones clone sizes top range. arguments AdjustAPOTC asks cluster indices input now also accept characters representing respective labels APackOfTheClones runs. argument recolor_indicies renamed recolor_indices AdjustAPOTC. countCloneSizes now outputs named list name cluster identity. Additionally, argument by_cluster can now also take single characters arguments representing possible alternative cluster identities metadata. Removed mini_seurat_obj publicly exported data. Several exported functions, including AdjustAPOTC, now stricter argument checking type length. Package can compiled compilers C++14 standard older releases R.

title: APackOfTheClones 1.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-04-05

title: APackOfTheClones 1.1.0
text: Add getSharedClones compute information clonotypes present multiple seurat clusters return user. Add showCloneHighlight extend scRepertoire analogue APackOfTheClones plot - comes many options certain clones appear differently existing plot. Add overlayLegend overlay/modify current legend clonal expansion plot. Add removeLegend remove existing legend clonal expansion plot. Add mergeCloneSizes merge clustered raw clone sizes one table. Added arguments countCloneSizes optionally get clones sizes cluster, optionally sort output. Added argument add_legend_centerspace APOTCPlot vizAPOTC adjust spacing guide circles values, cases guide circles exceedingly large radius. Added arguments AdjustAPOTC work labels locations Added argument verbose APOTCPlot display additional visual cues. Added argument alpha APOTCPlot vizAPOTC change alpha (transparency) circle. Added arguments APOTCPlot corresponding vizAPOTC compute plot “links” clonotypes “shared” .e. common within multiple clusters. Currently, supports plotting straight lines. Add vignette("APackOfTheClones-install") detailed installation instructions. Add vignette("APackOfTheClones-utils") guidance various utilities package. Add vignette("APackOfTheClones-shared") guidance working visualizing clonotypes shared among different seurat clusters.

title: APackOfTheClones 1.1.0
text: Fixed output truly list unnamed “table” objects, whereas , clusters valid clones, element instead list first element tabled clone sizes, also dimname "x". Fixed bug seurat object actual clones, function error instead returning list empty tables. fixed changed raw clone size objects stored ApotcData objects, objects pipelines used must re-ran forwards compatible! technically breaking change major version incremented since fix relatively trivial. vizAPOTC, RunAPOTC, APOTCPlot, fixed subsetting arguments ... extra_filter cases setting certain columns one level erase extra data. Altered ggplot object outputs APOTCPlot vizAPOTC work overlayLegend removeLegend introducing another element smaller size ApotcData object, layers now either named empty string layer label. Leftover ggplot objects previous versions updated re-running command (APOTCPlot/vizAPOTC) generated . Fixed functionality new_clone_scale_factor argument AdjustAPOTC guarantee true rescaling clone scale factor, internally estimated cluster radii correspondingly modified work potential repulsion. Circles legends clonal expansion plots now linetype rest circles plot generated APOTCPlot/vizAPOTC, whereas forced blank. Legend background now single geom_rect annotation black border instead white rectangle stacked top black rectangle. Many fixes behavior AdjustAPOTC

title: APackOfTheClones 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-01-13

title: APackOfTheClones 1.0.0
text: Add vizAPOTC replace clonal_expansion_plot similar arguments works completely differently additional set argument requirements, ultimately produce similar better visualization. Add RunAPOTC store multiple APackOfTheClones runs seurat object. Add containsApotcRun check existence run based ID. Add getApotcDataIds get APackOfTheClones run IDs. Add getLastApotcDataId get latest APackOfTheClones run ID. Add deleteApotcData delete data associate APackOfTheClones run. Add APOTCPlot plot APackOfTheClones run results ggplot. Add AdjustAPOTC modify certain attributes prior APackOfTheClones runs. Add countCloneSizes convenience function count clonotype sizes based clonecall allows subsetting seurat metadata Add getReductionCentroids convenience function get physical centroids cell reduction seurat object. Added two new vignettes pkgdown website indexed, viewed order vignette("APackOfTheClones") vignette("APackOfTheClones-runs").

title: APackOfTheClones 1.0.0

Package startup message modified notify users deprecation breaking changes. clonal expansion plots longer title default theme
